title: Self-similar solution
summary: In the study of partial differential equations, particularly in fluid dynamics, a self-similar solution is a form of solution  which is similar to itself if the independent and dependent variables are appropriately scaled. Self-similar solutions appear whenever the problem lacks a characteristic length or time scale (for example, the Blasius boundary layer of an infinite plate, but not of a finite-length plate).
